author: Alejandro Lazo
title: Justice Department Sues California Over Law Blocking Public Land Sales
text:
SAN FRANCISCO—The Justice Department sued California on Monday, seeking to block a new state law that restricts the U.S. government’s ability to sell and manage federal public lands.
The lawsuit, filed in U.S. District Court in Sacramento, challenges a 2017 law that requires the federal government to offer a “first right of refusal” to the California State Lands Commission prior to the sale or lease of any federally-owned public lands here.
...
